rename.from: [BUG] ForecastinPipeline cannot be constructed due to erroneous (?) type check
rename.to: [BUG] ForecastingPipeline cannot be constructed due to erroneous (?) type check

body:
The cause of this is that `TransformedTargetForecaster` has, in theory, *two* scitypes, per the inheritance check.

These are not correctly returned by the `scitype` utility which has a bug.
The check in ForecastingPipeline` also erroneously assumes that an estimator can have only one scitype.

rename.from: [BUG] ForecastingPipeline cannot be constructed due to erroneous (?) type check
rename.to: [BUG] ForecastingPipeline cannot be constructed due to erroneous type check

issue.title: [BUG] Fix type checking error due to pipeline type polymorphism when constructing nested pipelines

labels.name: bugfix
labels.description: Fixes a known bug or removes unintended behavior

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
This PR fixes three interacting bugs, causing #2455:

* an error in the `scitype` utility where None would be returned instead of a list of scitype in a case where the passed estimator was type polymorphic (had multiple scitypes). This is fixed.
* an error in the forecasting pipelines constructor check that would consider another forecasting pipeline as type-less and hence raise an error, because forecasting pipelines were expected to be constructed with transformers or forecasters. This is fixed by changing the default behaviour of `scitype` to what was assumed (just one type is returned).
* Since the `scitype` would come back empty for the `TransformedTargetForecaster`, no scenarios would be found in testing, because retrieval was based on the `scitype` utility. Now, with the change, scenarios are retrieved, and more tests are run, which (without fix) would fail, since tests for transformers are also run due to the polymorphism. This is remedied by removing transformer inheritance from `TransformedTargetForecaster` for now.

This PR also adds:
* a test for constructing a nested pipeline to ensure the functionality/ability of nesting pipelines does not get broken in the future.
* functionality to the `scitypes` function that forces it to return only a single scitype. Ties are resolved by the order in which the scitypes appear in the register, which prefers forecasters above transformers. This is enabled by default, as it was assumed by all references.

body:
FYI...I am getting this in pycaret as well after upgrading to 0.11.2

```python
from sktime.forecasting.naive import NaiveForecaster
from sktime.forecasting.compose import ForecastingPipeline, TransformedTargetForecaster

forecaster = TransformedTargetForecaster(
    steps=[
        ("model", NaiveForecaster(strategy="drift"))
    ]
)

pipe = ForecastingPipeline(
    steps=[("forecaster", forecaster)]
)
```

```python-traceback
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
[<ipython-input-15-5a138d05a5e2>](https://localhost:8080/#) in <module>()
     10 
     11 pipe = ForecastingPipeline(
---> 12     steps=[("forecaster", forecaster)]
     13 )
     14 # pipe.fit(y_train)

1 frames
[/usr/local/lib/python3.7/dist-packages/sktime/forecasting/compose/_pipeline.py](https://localhost:8080/#) in _check_steps(self, estimators, allow_postproc)
     62         if not set(scitypes).issubset(["forecaster", "transformer"]):
     63             raise TypeError(
---> 64                 f"estimators passed to {type(self).__name__} "
     65                 f"must be either transformer or forecaster"
     66             )

TypeError: estimators passed to ForecastingPipeline must be either transformer or forecaster
```

yes, will be fixed once #2456 is merged.
Sorry for this - this is resulting from the pipeline being both forecaster and transformer.

issue.title: Implement `transform` method for `ForecastingPipeline`

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/87bdf36dbc0990f29942eb6f7fa56a8e6c5fa7b7/sktime/forecasting/compose/_pipeline.py#L235

Similar to `TransformedTargetForecaster` (below), implement the `transform` method by wrapping the code above into its own method. This would be helpful to get the transformed X values.

https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/87bdf36dbc0990f29942eb6f7fa56a8e6c5fa7b7/sktime/forecasting/compose/_pipeline.py#L462-L481

issue.title: [ENH] Time Series Pipeline Update

labels.name: time_series
labels.description: Topics related to the time series

repository.name: pycaret
repository.description: An open-source, low-code machine learning library in Python

issue.body:
### Describe the feature you want to add to this project

The current time series pipeline is a custom pipeline based on `ForecstingPipeline` from `sktime`. This had to be built since in 0.10.1 version of `sktime`, `transform` method was not implemented for `ForecstingPipeline`. This means that we need to maintain the pipeline code in pycaret now instead of `sktime`

### Describe your proposed solution

The 0.11.2 version of `sktime` has implemented the transform (though there is a [bug in it](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/issues/2455) which should be resolved shortly). Once this is released, update pycaret pipeline to use `sktime` `ForecastingPipeline` instead of subclassing it in `pycaret`.

### Describe alternatives you've considered, if relevant

Continue with existing solution as a workaround until this is implemented.

### Additional context

_No response_
